title: `cargo doc` no longer generates a nav list of all dependencies in the sidebar

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a regression report! 🐛 A regression is something that changed between versions of Rust but was not supposed to.

Please provide a short summary of the regression, along with any information you feel is relevant to replicate it.
-->

Since i don't know which version, when running `cargo doc` on a project, the left sidebar of the docs no longer has a nav for all crates in the dependency graph. However, the documentation for all dependencies is still compiled.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Pick a Rust project with a few dependencies.
2. Run `cargo doc --open`
3. Expected: Left sidebar has a list of all dependencies, linking to each crate's local docs.
4. Got: No such thing.

### Version it worked on

<!--
Provide the most recent version this worked on, for example:

It most recently worked on: Rust 1.47
-->

It most recently worked on: I honestly don't remember. I update my nightly before every dev session. Allegedly that bug is 27 days old.

### Version with regression

<!--
Provide the version you are using that has the regression.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.54.0-nightly (ca82264ec 2021-05-09)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: ca82264ec7556a6011b9d3f1b2fd4c7cd0bc8ae2
commit-date: 2021-05-09
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.54.0-nightly
LLVM version: 12.0.1
```

<!--
If you know when this regression occurred, please add a line like below, replacing `{channel}` with one of stable, beta, or nightly.

@rustbot modify labels: +regression-from-stable-to-{channel} -regression-untriaged
-->
